2.text: Place the mango on a sturdy cutting board.

3.text: Use the serrated edge knife to cut the mango into three pieces.

5.text: Press the back side of the mango cheek up so the flesh pokes out.

6.text: Trim the segments off with a small paring knife.

7.text: Cut around the pit with a small paring knife.

8.text: Peel the skin from the remaining flesh.

11.text: Slice the top end and bottom off of the mango.

12.text: Insert a corn-on-the-cob holder in either end of the mango.

13.text: Use a knife to cut the mango into three pieces.

14.text: Trim the flesh off the pit.
